org.dgfoundation.amp.utils

Interface AmpCollectionUtils.NodeWorker<K,E,N>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - type of elements ID (Primary Key for example - Long usually)
    E - type of elements in source list
    N - type of element nodes
    All Superinterfaces:
    AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver<K,E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HelpTopicTreeNodeWorker
    Enclosing class:
    AmpCollectionUtils

    public static interface AmpCollectionUtils.NodeWorker<K,E,N>
extends AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver<K,E>
    Worker for building trees from flat lists. Notations: element - objects in source (flat) list, node - objects in tree. Both have same ID's: ID of element will also go to its corresponding node. This interface extends AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver and method that comes from it AmpCollectionUtils.KeyResolver.resolveKey(Object) should resolve ID of source list element. Basically implementations of this interface should "know" which methods to call on E and N. N can extend E to have less code, it also can be same class or from completely different class hierarchy.

    • Method Detail

      • getNodeChildren

        java.util.List<N> getNodeChildren(N node)
        Retrieves nodes children list. Should not be null because the list returned will be used to add found children. Calls getter for children list on node.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setNodeParent

        void setNodeParent(N child,
                   N Parent)
        Connects child to parent. Calls setter on child and passes parent to it.
        Parameters:

        Parent -

      • createTreeNode

        N createTreeNode(E element)
        Converts list element to tree node. Or creates tree node from list element.
        Parameters:
        element - flat (source) list element.
        Returns:
        tree node

      • getParentNodeId

        K getParentNodeId(N node)
        Returns ID of parent node. Node can "remember" this value from element it was created from, or can delegate to stored initial element. If node has no parent - it is top level node - then NULL value should be returned.
        Parameters:
        node - child node who's parent ID we want to get.
        Returns:
        parent ID of type K or NULL value if node has no parent.
